TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit X509ChainElement extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an element of an X.509 chain.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This object is constructed internally and is returned as part of an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainElementCollection> when calling the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain.ChainElements%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Certificate As X509Certificate2

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the X.509 certificate at a particular chain element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns an X.509 certificate for this element.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate the user selects.
[!code-cpp[x509chaintest#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509chaintest/CPP/x509chaintest.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[x509chaintest#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509chaintest/CS/x509chaintest.cs#4)] [!code-vb[x509chaintest#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509chaintest/vb/x509chaintest.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChainElementStatus As X509ChainStatus()

public: property cli::array <System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509ChainStatus> ^ ChainElementStatus { cli::array <System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509ChainStatus> ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the error status of the current X.509 certificate in a chain.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property returns an array of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainStatus> objects, each consisting of an error code bit and a descriptive localized error message.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Information As String
public: property System::String ^ Information { System::String ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets additional error information from an unmanaged certificate chain structure.
Docs.value: A string representing the member of the unmanaged structure in the Crypto API.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This string is available only on computers with Windows XP Professional or later operating systems. An empty string ("") is returned if the operating system is not Windows XP Professional or later.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, allows the user to select a certificate, then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate the user selects.
[!code-cpp[x509chaintest#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509chaintest/CPP/x509chaintest.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[x509chaintest#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509chaintest/CS/x509chaintest.cs#4)] [!code-vb[x509chaintest#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509chaintest/vb/x509chaintest.vb#4)]
